Goとは？.title: What is Go?
Goとは？.content:
# What is Go?

**Go** (Golang) is a programming language developed by Google in 2009.

## Go Features
1. **Simple and readable**: Concise syntax
2. **Fast compilation**: Very fast builds
3. **Great at concurrency**: Goroutines and channels
4. **Statically typed**: Type checking at compile time
5. **Garbage collection**: Automatic memory management

## Go Use Cases
- Web API servers
- Microservices
- CLI tools
- Cloud infrastructure (Docker, Kubernetes)

Hello World.title: Hello World

演習：開発環境セットアップ.title: Exercise: Development Environment Setup
演習：開発環境セットアップ.content:
# Exercise: Go Development Environment Setup

## Goal
Build Go development environment and run basic programs

## Steps

### 1. Verify Go Installation
```bash
# Check version
go version
# go version go1.22.0 windows/amd64

# Check environment variables
go env GOPATH
go env GOROOT
```

### 2. Create Workspace
```bash
mkdir -p ~/go-projects/hello
cd ~/go-projects/hello

# Initialize Go Modules
go mod init example.com/hello
```

### 3. Hello World Program
```go
// main.go
package main

import "fmt"

func main() {
    fmt.Println("Hello, Go!")
    fmt.Println("Go version:", runtime.Version())
}
```

### 4. Build and Run
```bash
# Run (build + execute)
go run main.go

# Build only
go build

# Run executable
./hello        # Linux/Mac
hello.exe      # Windows

# Cross-compile (Windows → Linux)
GOOS=linux GOARCH=amd64 go build -o hello-linux
```

### 5. Using Go Tools
```bash
# Format
go fmt main.go

# Code inspection
go vet main.go

# Check dependencies
go list -m all

# Organize dependencies
go mod tidy
```

## Checkpoints
- [ ] Go is installed
- [ ] GOPATH is set
- [ ] Created project with go mod init
- [ ] Ran program with go run
- [ ] Created executable with go build

トラブルシューティング：よくある問題.title: Troubleshooting: Common Issues
トラブルシューティング：よくある問題.content:
# Troubleshooting: Common Issues

## Issue 1: go command not found

**Cause:** PATH not set

**Solution:**
```bash
# Windows (PowerShell)
$env:PATH += ";C:\Go\bin"

# Linux/Mac (bash)
export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/go/bin
export PATH=$PATH:$HOME/go/bin

# Make permanent (.bashrc or .zshrc)
echo 'export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/go/bin' >> ~/.bashrc
```

## Issue 2: package XXX is not in GOROOT

**Cause:** Go Modules not initialized

**Solution:**
```bash
go mod init example.com/myproject
go mod tidy
```

## Issue 3: import cycle not allowed

**Cause:** Circular package reference

**Solution:**
- Review package structure
- Separate common types into different package
- Invert dependencies using interfaces

## Issue 4: undefined: XXX

**Cause:** Variable or function undefined

**Check:**
```bash
# Show detailed build errors
go build -v

# Show type information
go doc fmt.Println
```

## Issue 5: race condition detected

**Diagnosis:**
```bash
# Enable race detector
go run -race main.go
go test -race
```

**Solution:**
- Use mutex
- Synchronize with channels
- Use atomic operations

package main

import "fmt"

func main() {
    var message string = "Hello"
    count := 100
    pi := 3.14
    
    fmt.Println(message, count, pi)
}

データ型の詳細.title: Data Type Details
データ型の詳細.content:
# Go Data Types

## Basic Types

### Integer Types
```go
var a int8    // -128 ~ 127
var b int16   // -32768 ~ 32767
var c int32   // -2147483648 ~ 2147483647
var d int64   // -9223372036854775808 ~ 9223372036854775807
var e int     // Architecture dependent (32 or 64 bit)

var f uint8   // 0 ~ 255
var g uint16  // 0 ~ 65535
var h uint32  // 0 ~ 4294967295
var i uint64  // 0 ~ 18446744073709551615
var j uint    // Architecture dependent

var k byte    // Alias for uint8
var l rune    // Alias for int32 (Unicode code point)
```

### Floating Point Types
```go
var x float32  // ±1.18e-38 ~ ±3.4e38
var y float64  // ±2.23e-308 ~ ±1.80e308
var z complex64   // Real and imaginary parts of float32
var w complex128  // Real and imaginary parts of float64
```

### Other Types
```go
var flag bool        // true or false
var text string      // String (UTF-8)
var ptr *int         // Pointer
```

## Zero Values

In Go, uninitialized variables are automatically set to zero values:

```go
var i int       // 0
var f float64   // 0.0
var b bool      // false
var s string    // "" (empty string)
var p *int      // nil
```

型変換とconst.title: Type Conversion and const

演習：温度変換プログラム.title: Exercise: Temperature Conversion Program
演習：温度変換プログラム.content:
# Exercise: Temperature Conversion Program

## Goal
Create a Celsius to Fahrenheit temperature conversion program

## Requirements

1. Get Celsius temperature from user
2. Convert to Fahrenheit and display
3. Fahrenheit = Celsius × 9/5 + 32

## Sample Code

```go
package main

import "fmt"

func main() {
    var celsius float64
    
    fmt.Print("Enter Celsius temperature: ")
    fmt.Scan(&celsius)
    
    // Convert to Fahrenheit
    fahrenheit := celsius*9/5 + 32
    
    fmt.Printf("%.2f°C = %.2f°F\n", celsius, fahrenheit)
    
    // Bonus: Absolute zero check
    const AbsoluteZero = -273.15
    if celsius < AbsoluteZero {
        fmt.Println("Warning: Temperature below absolute zero")
    }
}
```

## Extended Challenges

1. Add Fahrenheit→Celsius conversion
2. Add Kelvin temperature
3. Convert multiple temperatures at once
4. Temperature validity check

## Execution Example

```
Enter Celsius temperature: 25
25.00°C = 77.00°F

Enter Celsius temperature: -300
-300.00°C = -508.00°F
Warning: Temperature below absolute zero
```

第3週：演算子と式.title: Week 3: Operators and Expressions
第3週：演算子と式.description: Learning arithmetic operators, comparison operators, logical operators

算術演算子.title: Arithmetic Operators
算術演算子.content:
package main

import "fmt"

func main() {
    a, b := 10, 3
    
    fmt.Println(a + b)  // 13
    fmt.Println(a - b)  // 7
    fmt.Println(a * b)  // 30
    fmt.Println(a / b)  // 3
    fmt.Println(a % b)  // 1
}

第4週：ユーザー入力とフォーマット.title: Week 4: User Input and Formatting
第4週：ユーザー入力とフォーマット.description: Input using fmt.Scan() and formatted output using fmt.Printf()

ユーザー入力.title: User Input
ユーザー入力.content:
package main

import "fmt"

func main() {
    var name string
    var age int
    
    fmt.Print("Enter name: ")
    fmt.Scan(&name)
    
    fmt.Print("Enter age: ")
    fmt.Scan(&age)
    
    fmt.Printf("%s is %d years old\n", name, age)
}

Goのパッケージ.title: Go Packages
Goのパッケージ.content:
# Go Packages

## Creating Packages

```go
// mypackage/mypackage.go
package mypackage

func Hello(name string) string {
    return "Hello, " + name
}
```

## Using Packages

```go
// main.go
package main

import (
    "fmt"
    "myproject/mypackage"
)

func main() {
    msg := mypackage.Hello("Gopher")
    fmt.Println(msg)
}
```

## Go Modules
```bash
# Initialize module
go mod init example.com/myproject

# Add dependencies
go get github.com/gin-gonic/gin

# Organize dependencies
go mod tidy
```

テストの書き方.title: How to Write Tests

Goのベストプラクティス.title: Go Best Practices
Goのベストプラクティス.content:
# Go Best Practices

## Coding Style
1. Format with `gofmt`
2. Lint with `golint`
3. Always check errors
4. Use short variable names
5. Keep interfaces small

## Project Structure
```
myproject/
├── cmd/
│   └── myapp/
│       └── main.go
├── internal/
│   └── package/
├── pkg/
│   └── public/
├── go.mod
└── go.sum
```

## Error Handling
- Don't ignore errors
- Appropriate error messages
- Use custom error types

## Performance
- Write benchmarks
- Use profiling
- Avoid unnecessary allocations

REST API完全実装例.title: Complete REST API Implementation Example

最終課題：Todo API with PostgreSQL.title: Final Assignment: Todo API with PostgreSQL
最終課題：Todo API with PostgreSQL.content:
# Final Assignment: Todo REST API

## Goal
Build a complete REST API using Gin + PostgreSQL + Goroutines

## Requirements

### 1. Functional Requirements
- [ ] CRUD operations (Create, Read, Update, Delete)
- [ ] PostgreSQL database connection
- [ ] JWT authentication
- [ ] Validation
- [ ] Error handling
- [ ] Logging
- [ ] Tests

### 2. Endpoints

```
POST   /api/auth/register  - User registration
POST   /api/auth/login     - Login
GET    /api/todos          - Get todo list
GET    /api/todos/:id      - Get todo details
POST   /api/todos          - Create todo
PUT    /api/todos/:id      - Update todo
DELETE /api/todos/:id      - Delete todo
```

### 3. Database Schema

```sql
CREATE TABLE users (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    username VARCHAR(50) UNIQUE NOT NULL,
    password VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE todos (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INT REFERENCES users(id),
    title VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    description TEXT,
    completed BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    due_date TIMESTAMP,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
);
```

### 4. Project Structure

```
todo-api/
├── main.go
├── go.mod
├── go.sum
├── config/
│   └── database.go
├── models/
│   ├── user.go
│   └── todo.go
├── controllers/
│   ├── auth.go
│   └── todo.go
├── middleware/
│   ├── auth.go
│   └── logger.go
├── routes/
│   └── routes.go
├── utils/
│   ├── jwt.go
│   └── validator.go
└── tests/
    ├── auth_test.go
    └── todo_test.go
```

### 5. Sample Implementation (models/todo.go)

```go
package models

import "time"

type Todo struct {
    ID          int       `json:"id"`
    UserID      int       `json:"user_id"`
    Title       string    `json:"title" binding:"required,min=3,max=255"`
    Description string    `json:"description"`
    Completed   bool      `json:"completed"`
    DueDate     time.Time `json:"due_date"`
    CreatedAt   time.Time `json:"created_at"`
    UpdatedAt   time.Time `json:"updated_at"`
}
```

### 6. Test Implementation

```go
// tests/todo_test.go
package tests

import (
    "testing"
    "github.com/stretchr/testify/assert"
)

func TestCreateTodo(t *testing.T) {
    // Test code
    assert.Equal(t, expected, actual)
}
```

### 7. Execution

```bash
# Install dependencies
go mod init todo-api
go get github.com/gin-gonic/gin
go get gorm.io/gorm
go get gorm.io/driver/postgres
go get github.com/golang-jwt/jwt/v5

# Run
go run main.go

# Test
go test ./...

# Build
go build -o todo-api
```

## Evaluation Criteria

- Code Quality: 30 points
- Feature Completeness: 30 points
- Error Handling: 15 points
- Tests: 15 points
- Documentation: 10 points

## Bonus Challenges

- [ ] Dockerize (+5 points)
- [ ] CI/CD (GitHub Actions) (+5 points)
- [ ] WebSocket notifications (+10 points)
- [ ] Caching (Redis) (+5 points)
